citeinfo.origin: Oregon Department of Geology and Mineral Industries (DOGAMI)
citeinfo.title: Completed Oregon Lidar Consortium Projects

descript.abstract: This GIS dataset contains polygons depicting project areas that the Oregon Lidar Consortium have completed within Oregon.
descript.purpose: This web service contains polygon layers depicting the extents of project areas in Oregon that the Oregon Lidar Consortium have completed.
descript.supplinf: The project areas were collected for the Oregon Department of Geology and Mineral Industries under State of Oregon Agency-Specific Price Agreement. The price agreement specifies in Section 2.2 that the vendor provide classified LAS files, intensity grids, digital elevation models (DEMs), digital surface models (DSMs) vector files, and a survey report.

timeperd.current: This dataset represents the bounding polygons for Oregon Lidar Consortium projects that have been completed.

idinfo.accconst: No restrictions apply to this data.
idinfo.useconst: Users of this information should review or consult the primary data and information sources to ascertain the usability of the information. Acknowledgement of Oregon Department of Geology and Industries would be appreciated for products derived from these data.

cntorgp.cntorg: Oregon Department of Geology and Mineral Industries (DOGAMI)

cntinfo.hours: Monday through Friday 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM (Pacific Standard Time)
cntinfo.cntinst: When contacting DOGAMI about this data set, please reference the data set title or other identifying information in your correspondence. DOGAMI publications can be downloaded from http://www.oregongeology.org

idinfo.datacred: Oregon Department of Geology and Mineral Industries, DOGAMI, Oregon Lidar Consortium, OLC
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.2.3552

dataqual.logic: A visual qualitative assessment was performed to ensure data completeness. No void areas or missing data exist.
dataqual.complete: This dataset was last updated March 20, 2017.

procstep.procdesc: The Oregon Department of Geology and Mineral Industries (DOGAMI) conducts quality control and quality assurance on the lidar data delivered by its vendor. If the data has met all lidar specifications and quality metrics in Exhibit A of Oregon State Specific Agreement, then the project is considered complete. Once a project is complete, DOGAMI makes the data available to Oregon Lidar Consortium project partners that help pay for the data collection. DOGAMI also makes the data available to the public on its Lidar Data Viewer website.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Size of the project area in square miles.
Dates that the lidar was acquired in the project area.

attrdomv.udom: These are date ranges during which lidar data was collected within the project area.

attr.attrdef: Projection of the lidar data acquired for this project.

codesetd.codesetn: The EPSG Geodetic Parameter Dataset is a collection of definitions of coordinate reference systems and coordinate transformations which may be global, regional, national or local in application.
codesetd.codesets: International Association of Oil and Gas Producers

attr.attrdef: The vertical datum of the lidar data collected for this project.

codesetd.codesetn: Vertical control datum of orthometric height established for vertical control surveying in the United States of America based upon the General Adjustment of the North American Datum of 1988.

attr.attrdef: Horizontal datum of lidar data collected within this project area.

codesetd.codesetn: Horizontal datum is a reference system for specifying positions on the Earth's surface. Horizontal datums have been defined by specifying the 2-D geometric surface using a reference ellipsoid and six topocentric parameters expressing origin, and orientation.

attr.attrdef: Name of the lidar collection project.

attrdomv.udom: The name of the lidar collection. This is established by the Oregon Lidar Consortium. Typically a project name will be based on a geographic feature or local name of the study area.

attr.attrdef: Hyperlink to the survey report for this project.

attrdomv.udom: A hyperlink to the survey report. This hyperlink is created and maintained by the Oregon Department of Geology and Mineral Industries.

attr.attrdef: The entity that coordinated the lidar collection.

attrdomv.udom: The name of entity that coordinated the lidar collection. These are typically local, state or federal agencies.

attr.attrdef: Hyperlink to a zip file containing the compressed version of this shapefile.

attrdomv.udom: A hyperlink to a zip file containing the compressed version of this shapefile. This hyperlink is created and maintained by the Oregon Department of Geology and Mineral Industries.
